Author: MonaizeSupport
Title: [ANN][MNZ][B2B] Monaize - Banking Meets Blockchain
Body: We are currently reworking our whitepaper as there have been a few new hires. You can view the original team on our old whitepaper at www.monaize.com Currently we are securing pre-sale positions even though the contribution limit is quite high.  Quote from: Moris1987 on April 06, 2018, 05:19:48 PM So what can you offer better than Bankera? They already having functional product aka Spectrocoin where sheres are distributed monthly.  We are not in competition with Bankera as they do not provide B2B current accounts last time I checked. In comparison we provide only business current accounts for client companies as they are the most underbanked in the world. We currently have a working product as well, ours is simply in closed beta, streamlining the sign up process. Another distinct difference is that we are not going to be based on another blockchain (either based on NEM or ERC20 as far as I can tell), and are going to be beginning with our own blockchain as an asset of the Komodo Platform. Further, the ICO for bankera has already concluded if I am not mistaken, ours has yet to begin. Further we will not be providing exchange services to the general public. Our accounts will be the first to be a business current account with a built in cryptocurrency wallet. Additionally it seems that Bankera does not exactly provide current accounts but instead will launch an exchange on top of its coin protocol.

Body: Absolutely!  So the big things that came out of the AMA were a few well worded questions. I will do my best to summarize.  One that was asked was about the hardcap. A direct quote from Robert follows, "The price of btc has exploded since we first set out to the ICO and with our current hard cap of 10 000 btc we have realised this is to much. WE WILL BE LOWERING THIS AMOUNT. The actual raise amount will be communicated when we announce the new date for the ICO."  When asked about the date for the ICO, it was reiterated that we have an internal date set, but due to the two delays we have had thus far we wont be announcing the date until we are 110% sure it will be the final date.  We discussed the mechanics of mining and how that will look when "merged" with the Komodo Platform and then when and if it will be appropriate to discuss a split.  Masternodes were also inquired about, and we mentioned that this is not currently in the road map but something that we could absolutely do in the future as the blockchain is our own and we are able to change or include protocols as needed.  One member inquired to the price of KMD falling abruptly when the second delay occurred, relating it to current market businesses and relating to their stocks. A response from Vincent follows  "This is not our business, our banking partners PFS or Wacecrest has also their human ressources issues, this happen in all companies. We are concentrating fully on our services, and making sure that our partners provide us with the highest level of services, if their stock prices or currency goes up or down, that is not our concern"  There were some questions raised about the Komodo Platform, one of which was how we could offer an ICO on a platform/cryptocurrency that doesnt have a legal entity behind it. A response from our CEO follows:  "The tokens are issued by Monaize Pte. Ltd. which is a legal entity in Singapore. And the Blockchain is an indépendant private Monaize Blockchain, all nodes (servers) are managed and paid by Monaize. All this relationships are binned with legal contracts. Like I said before, Komodo is a service provider to Monaize."  Additionally there were questions raised in relation to a recent article about the CEO of Komodo. The question was responded to by our CEO Vincent below:  "We at Monaize have nothing to do with the person that you indicated. Komodo is a blockchain service provider to Monaize and also a minority share holder in Monaize. We consider this as a Komodo's human resource issue and we have nothing to add to it. Technological companies have often incidents like this unfortunately, individual are often trying to do some buzz and maybe sometimes trying to make some money out of it. We at Monaize are also working closely with the head technical team from Komodo and we are not informed about the product manager that you mentioned. Activities going on in Komodo, got nothing to do with the launching of our dICO."  Lastly, but some would argue not least, it was argued that British beers are far inferior to all German beers. Consensus was reached on this argument that German beers were better.  If you have anymore questions please feel free to ask them here or in telegram at t.me/MonaizeOfficial

Author: _ChucK_
Title: [ANN][MNZ][B2B] Monaize - Banking Meets Blockchain
Body: Let me share my skepticism about the Monaize project… For what purposes will the MNZ token be used? At the moment, only for the implementation of the loyalty program? I.e. the actual working application of the token on the platform is not present and, probably, will not be. Representatives of the team ask in telegram-chat what application users would like to see for the token. And this is only a week before ICO , before they sell us these tokens! If the token does not have an application, it does not cost anything! This is a trinket for the sake of taking money through the ICO. But what about the loyalty program, you ask? Passive income - it's cool! Loyalty program ... Let's count a little. Information for calculations is on page 25 of the WP. Let's consider the 5th year. If KMD will cost $ 1 and «NUMBER OF MONTHLY SIGN UPS» = 500000 (as noted in the WP), then by the formula we will all get (5*500000)/1 = 2500000 KMD. I.e 2500000(KMD)*1($) = 2500000 $ for everyone. If KMD will cost $ 100 and «NUMBER OF MONTHLY SIGN UPS» = 500000 (as noted in the WP), then by the formula we will all get (5*500000)/100 = 25000 KMD. I.e 25000(KMD)*100($) = 2500000 $ for everyone. That is the same as in the first case. The number in dollars is equal to the number of signers, multiplied by the bonus (x2/3/x4/x5 depending on the year). That is, from 2018 to 2021 (according to WP), users will receive 40,944,000 $. But with at a rate of 7000 for BTC developers will receive on ICO with a max cup 70,000,000 $. Catch the thought? You give them 70 million, and after 4 years you get a total of 41 mln. I.e. even after 4 years you will not return your investment. Where is the mistake? Show me please! I really hope that somewhere I was wrong. Will there be a loyalty program after 2021? In the WP, nothing is said about this… They say, well, we are building a bank of the future! It's the most important! Yeah, yeah, ok… But what will be for the person who will now give his money for implementation? What profit? The Monaize will have a bank and business, and what will get ICO-participants? In my opinion, it would be fair for passive earnings to allocate a portion of the annual cost of customer service, and not just for SIGN UPS. That there was an analogue of owning shares, not candy wrappers, i.e. to get a part of the company's profits. Or do you think those who give you money are fools, and that they do not deserve fair compensation, as in large real companies. As a KMD-holder, I do not want to throw them into the wind. Argumented criticism is welcome. What did I miss?
